TypeSignature.Value: Public MustInherit Class Transformer Inherits Object
public ref class Transformer abstract : Java::Lang::Object
.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit Transformer extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: An instance of this abstract class can transform a source tree into a result tree.

remarks.para: An instance of this abstract class can transform a source tree into a result tree.

An instance of this class can be obtained with the TransformerFactory#newTransformer TransformerFactory.newTransformer method. This instance may then be used to process XML from a variety of sources and write the transformation output to a variety of sinks.
An object of this class may not be used in multiple threads running concurrently. Different Transformers may be used concurrently by different threads.
A Transformer may be used multiple times. Parameters and output properties are preserved across transformations.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Sub Reset ()
public: virtual void Reset();
public virtual void Reset ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Reset() cil managed
abstract member Reset : unit -> unit override this.Reset : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Reset this Transformer to its original configuration.

remarks.para: Reset this Transformer to its original configuration.

Transformer is reset to the same state as when it was created with TransformerFactory#newTransformer(), TransformerFactory#newTransformer(Source source) or Templates#newTransformer(). reset() is designed to allow the reuse of existing Transformers thus saving resources associated with the creation of new Transformers.

The reset Transformer is not guaranteed to have the same URIResolver or ErrorListenerObjects, e.g. Object#equals(Object obj). It is guaranteed to have a functionally equal URIResolver and ErrorListener.
Added in 1.5.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride Sub SetOutputProperty (name As String, value As String)
public: abstract void SetOutputProperty(System::String ^ name, System::String ^ value);
public abstract void SetOutputProperty (string? name, string? value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetOutputProperty(string name, string value) cil managed
abstract member SetOutputProperty : string * string -> unit

Docs.param: A non-null String that specifies an output property name, which may be namespace qualified.
The non-null string value of the output property.
Docs.summary: Set an output property that will be in effect for the transformation.

remarks.para: Set an output property that will be in effect for the transformation.

Pass a qualified property name as a two-part string, the namespace URI enclosed in curly braces ({}), followed by the local name. If the name has a null URL, the String only contain the local name. An application can safely check for a non-null URI by testing to see if the first character of the name is a '{' character.

For example, if a URI and local name were obtained from an element defined with <xyz:foo xmlns:xyz="http://xyz.foo.com/yada/baz.html"/>, then the qualified name would be "{http://xyz.foo.com/yada/baz.html}foo". Note that no prefix is used.
The Properties object that was passed to #setOutputProperties won't be effected by calling this method.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: If the property is not supported, and is not qualified with a namespace.

abstract member SetParameter : string * Java.Lang.Object -> unit

Docs.param: The name of the parameter, which may begin with a namespace URI in curly braces ({}).
The value object. This can be any valid Java object. It is up to the processor to provide the proper object coercion or to simply pass the object on for use in an extension.
Docs.summary: Add a parameter for the transformation.

remarks.para: Add a parameter for the transformation.

Pass a qualified name as a two-part string, the namespace URI enclosed in curly braces ({}), followed by the local name. If the name has a null URL, the String only contain the local name. An application can safely check for a non-null URI by testing to see if the first character of the name is a '{' character.

For example, if a URI and local name were obtained from an element defined with <xyz:foo xmlns:xyz="http://xyz.foo.com/yada/baz.html"/>, then the qualified name would be "{http://xyz.foo.com/yada/baz.html}foo". Note that no prefix is used.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Transform(class Javax.Xml.Transform.ISource xmlSource, class Javax.Xml.Transform.IResult outputTarget) cil managed
abstract member Transform : Javax.Xml.Transform.ISource * Javax.Xml.Transform.IResult -> unit

Docs.param: The Result of transforming the xmlSource.
Docs.summary: Transform the XML Source to a Result.

remarks.para: Transform the XML Source to a Result. Specific transformation behavior is determined by the settings of the TransformerFactory in effect when the Transformer was instantiated and any modifications made to the Transformer instance.

An empty Source is represented as an empty document as constructed by javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilder#newDocument(). The result of transforming an empty Source depends on the transformation behavior; it is not always an empty Result.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: If an unrecoverable error occurs during the course of the transformation.
